metadata.Title: CVE-2022-25314 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5, there is an integer overflow incopyString.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.4
libexpat1 - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.9-1ubuntu0.4').
xmlrpc-c package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
